variant_lists.name: Internal profile control
variant_lists.description: Ineffective unless CFR1[31] = 1. These bits are effective without the need for an I/O update.

variants.name: Execute Profile 0, then Profile 1, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 2, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 3, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 4, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 5, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 6, then halt.
Execute Profile 0 to Profile 7, then halt.

bits.name: RAM enable
bits.description:
0 = disables RAM functionality (default).
1 = enables RAM functionality (required for both load/retrieve and playback operation).

bits.name: Manual OSK external control
bits.description:
Ineffective unless CFR1[9:8] = 10b.
0 = OSK pin inoperative (default).
1 = OSK pin enabled for manual OSK control (see Output Shift Keying (OSK)
 section for details).

bits.name: Inverse sinc filter enable
bits.description:
0 = inverse sinc filter bypassed (default).
1 = inverse sinc filter active.

bits.name: Select DDS sine output
bits.description:
0 = cosine output of the DDS is selected (default).
1 = sine output of the DDS is selected.

bits.name: Load LRR @ I/O update
bits.description:
Ineffective unless CFR2[19] = 1.
0 = normal operation of the digital ramp timer (default).
1 = digital ramp timer loaded any time I/O_UPDATE is asserted
 or a PROFILE[2:0] change occurs.

bits.name: Autoclear digital ramp accumulator
bits.description:
0 = normal operation of the DRG accumulator (default).
1 = the ramp accumulator is reset for one cycle of the DDS clock after which the accumulator
 automatically resumes normal operation. As long as this bit remains set, the ramp
accumulator is momentarily reset each time an I/O_UPDATE is asserted or a PROFILE[2:0]
change occurs. This bit is synchronized with either an I/O _UPDATE or a PROFILE[2:0]
change and the next rising edge of SYNC_CLK.

bits.name: Autoclear phase accumulator
bits.description:
0 = normal operation of the DDS phase accumulator (default).
1 = synchronously resets the DDS phase accumulator anytime I/O_UPDATE is asserted or a 
profile change occurs.

bits.name: Clear digital ramp accumulator
bits.description:
0 = normal operation of the DRG accumulator (default).
1 = asynchronous, static reset of the DRG accumulator. The ramp accumulator remains reset
as long as this bit remains set. This bit is synchronized with either an I/O_UPDATE or a
PROFILE[2:0] change and the next rising edge of SYNC_CLK.

bits.name: Clear phase accumulator
bits.description:
0 = normal operation of the DDS phase accumulator (default).
1 = asynchronous, static reset of the DDS phase accumulator.

bits.name: Load ARR @ I/O update
bits.description:
Ineffective unless CFR1[9:8] = 11b.
0 = normal operation of the OSK amplitude ramp rate timer (default).
1 = OSK amplitude ramp rate timer reloaded anytime I/O_UPDATE is asserted or a
PROFILE[2:0] change occurs.

bits.name: OSK enable
bits.description:
The output shift keying enable bit.
0 = OSK disabled (default).
1 = OSK enabled.

bits.name: Select auto OSK
bits.description:
Ineffective unless CFR1[9] = 1.
0 = manual OSK enabled (default).
1 = automatic OSK enabled.

bits.name: Digital power-down
bits.description:
This bit is effective without the need for an I/O update.
0 = clock signals to the digital core are active (default).
1 = clock signals to the digital core are disabled.

bits.name: DAC power-down
bits.description:
0 = DAC clock signals and bias circuits are active (default).
1 = DAC clock signals and bias circuits are disabled.

bits.name: REFCLK input power-down
bits.description:
This bit is effective without the need for an I/O update.
0 = REFCLK input circuits and PLL are active (default).
1 = REFCLK input circuits and PLL are disabled.

bits.name: AUX DAC power-down
bits.description:
0 = auxiliary DAC clock signals and bias circuits are active (default).
1 = auxiliary DAC clock signals and bias circuits are disabled.

bits.name: Ext. power-down
bits.description:
0 = assertion of the EXT_PWR_DWN pin affects full power-down (default).
1 = assertion of the EXT_PWR_DWN pin affects fast recovery power-down.

bits.name: SDIO input only
bits.description:
0 = configures the SDIO pin for bidirectional operation; 2-wire serial programming mode(default).
1 = configures the serial data I/O pin (SDIO) as an input only pin; 3-wire serial programming mode

bits.name: LSB first
bits.description:
0 = configures the serial I/O port for MSB-first format (default).
1 = configures the serial I/O port for LSB-first format.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

variant_lists.name: I/O update rate control
variant_lists.description:
Ineffective unless CFR2[23] = 1. Sets the prescale ratio of the divider that
clocks the auto I/O update timer

bits.name: Enable amplitude scale from single tone profiles
bits.description:
Ineffective if CFR2[19 ] = 1 or CFR1[31] = 1 or CFR1[9] = 1.
0 = the amplitude scaler is bypassed and shut down for power conservation (default).
1 = the amplitude is scaled by the ASF from the active profile.

bits.name: Internal I/O update active
bits.description:
This bit is effective without the need for an I/O update.
0 = serial I/O programming is synchronized with the external assertion of the
I/O_UPDATE pin, which is configured as an input pin (default).
1 = serial I/O programming is synchronized with an internally generated I/O
update signal (the internally generated
signal appears at the I/O_UPDATE pin, which is configured as an output pin).

bits.name: SYNC_CLK enable
bits.description:
0 = the SYNC_CLK pin is disabled; static Logic 0 output.
1 = the SYNC_CLK pin generates a clock signal at ¼ fSYSCLK; used for synchronization of the serial I/O port (default).

bits.name: Digital ramp enable
bits.description:
0 = disables digital ramp generator functionality (default).
1 = enables digital ramp generator functionality.

bits.name: Digital ramp no-dwell high
bits.description:
See the Digital Ramp Generator (DRG) section for details.
0 = disables no-dwell high functionality (default).
1 = enables no-dwell high functionality.

bits.name: Digital ramp no-dwell low
bits.description:
See the Digital Ramp Generator (DRG) section for details.
0 = disables no-dwell low functionality (default).
1 = enables no-dwell low functionality.

bits.name: Read effective FTW
bits.description:
0 = a serial I/O port read operation of the FTW register reports the contents of the FTW register (default).
1 = a serial I/O port read operation of the FTW register reports the actual 32-bit word appearing at the input to the DDS phase accumulator.

bits.name: PDCLK enable
bits.description:
0 = the PDCLK pin is disabled and forced to a static Logic 0 state; the internal clock signal continues to operate and provide timing to the data assembler.
1 = the internal PDCLK signal appears at the PDCLK pin (default).

bits.name: PDCLK invert
bits.description:
0 = normal PDCLK polarity; Q-data associated with Logic 1, I-data with Logic 0 (default).
1 = inverted PDCLK polarity.

bits.name: TxEnable invert
bits.description:
0 = no inversion.
1 = inversion.

bits.name: Matched latency enable
bits.description:
0 = simultaneous application of amplitude, phase, and frequency changes to the DDS
arrive at the output in the order listed (default).
1 = simultaneous application of amplitude, phase, and frequency changes to the DDS
arrive at the output simultaneously.

bits.name: Data assembler hold last value
bits.description:
Ineffective unless CFR2[4] = 1.
0 = the data assembler of the parallel data port internally forces zeros on the data path
and ignores the signals on the D[15:0] and F[1:0] pins while the TxENABLE pin is Logic 0
(default). This implies that the destination of the data at the parallel data port is
amplitude when TxENABLE is Logic 0.
1 = the data assembler of the parallel data port internally forces the last value received
on the D[15:0] and F[1:0] pins while the TxENABLE pin is Logic 1.

bits.name: Sync timing validation disable
bits.description:
0 = enables the SYNC_SMP_ERR pin to indicate (active high) detection
of a synchronization pulse sampling error.
1 = the SYNC_SMP_ERR pin is forced to a static Logic 0 condition (default).

bits.name: Parallel data port enable
bits.description:
See the Parallel Data Port Modulation Mode section for more details.
0 = disables parallel data port modulation functionality (default).
1 = enables parallel data port modulation functionality.

integers.name: FM gain
integers.description: The FM gain word allows the user to apply a weighting factor to the 16-bit data-word.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

bits.name: REFCLK input divider bypass
bits.description:
0 = input divider is selected (default).
1 = input divider is bypassed.

bits.name: REFCLK input divider ResetB
bits.description:
0 = input divider is reset.
1 = input divider operates normally (default).

bits.name: PFD reset
bits.description:
0 = normal operation (default).
1 = phase detector disabled.

bits.name: PLL enable
bits.description:
0 = REFCLK PLL bypassed (default).
1 = REFCLK PLL enabled.

variant_lists.name: VCO SEL
variant_lists.description: Selects the frequency band of the REFCLK PLL VCO.

variant_lists.name: Icp
variant_lists.description: Selects the charge pump current in the REFCLK PLL.

integers.name: MOD2
integers.description: This 7-bit number is the divide modulus of the REFCLK PLL feedback divider.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: I/O update rate
integers.description: This 8-bit number controls the full-scale output current of the main DAC.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: I/O update rate
integers.description:
Ineffective unless CFR2[23] = 1. This 32-bit number controls the automatic I/O update
rate (see the Automatic I/O Update section for details).

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Frequency tuning word
integers.description: 32-bit frequency tuning word.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Phase offset word
integers.description: 16-bit phase offset word.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Amplitude ramp rate
integers.description: 16-bit amplitude ramp rate value. Effective only if CFR1[9:8] = 11b.

integers.name: Amplitude scale factor
integers.description: 14-bit amplitude scale factor.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

bits.name: Sync receiver enable
bits.description:
0 = synchronization clock receiver disabled (default).
1 = synchronization clock receiver enabled.

bits.name: Sync generator enable
bits.description:
0 = synchronization clock generator disabled (default).
1 = synchronization clock generator enabled.

bits.name: Sync generator polarity
bits.description:
0 = synchronization clock generator coincident with the rising edge of SYSCLK (default).
1 = synchronization clock generator coincident with the falling edge of SYSCLK.

integers.name: Sync validation delay
integers.description:
This 4-bit number sets the timing skew (in ~75ps increments) between SYSCLK and the
delayed SYNC_INx signal for the sync validation block in the sync receiver.

integers.name: Sync state preset value
integers.description: This 6-bit number is the state that the internal clock generator assumes when it receives a sync pulse.

integers.name: Output sync generator delay
integers.description: This 5-bit number sets the output delay (in ~75 ps increments) of the sync generator.

integers.name: Input sync receiver delay
integers.description: This 5-bit number sets the input delay (in ~75 ps increments) of the sync receiver.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Digital ramp upper limit
integers.description: 32-bit digital ramp upper limit value.

integers.name: Digital ramp lower limit
integers.description: 32-bit digital ramp lower limit value.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Digital ramp decrement step size
integers.description: 32-bit digital ramp decrement step size value.

integers.name: Digital ramp increment step size
integers.description: 32-bit digital ramp increment step size value.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Digital ramp negative slope rate
integers.description:
16-bit digital ramp negative slope value that defines the
 time interval between decrement values.

integers.name: Digital ramp positive slope rate
integers.description:
16-bit digital ramp positive slope value that defines the
 time interval between increment values.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)

integers.name: Amplitude scale factor
integers.description: This 14-bit number controls the DDS output amplitude.

integers.name: Phase offset word
integers.description: This 16-bit number controls the DDS phase offset.

integers.name: Frequency tuning word
integers.description: This 32-bit number controls the DDS frequency.

fixed.name: Intsruction word
fixed.description: D4-D0 - address, D7 - R/nW (0 - is write)
